Now, an introduction to the language.
The Japanese language has a unique writing
system made up of 3 different types of
characters. These sets of characters are
known as Hiragana, Katakana and Kanji.
Hiragana is the basic set of characters,
and by using Hiragana you can form almost
any sentence in Japanese. We will be
focusing our efforts on Hiragana during
The other two character sets are a bit
exclusively to represent words from foreign
languages. Kanji is a complex character set
Kanji is quite advanced, but learning it
Back to Hiragana! There are 46 basic
Hiragana characters, and each one is used
to represent a unique sound or syllable.
You can also make an additional 25 Hiragana
characters by adding small strokes to
specific characters, and we will learn this

you begin to feel overwhelmed, take a break
and come back with a refreshed mind.
